DefensiveAbilities.Poison Point: On melee attacks made by this Pokémon, roll a d10 on a hit. On a result of a 10, the target is poisoned.
DefensiveAbilities.Rivalry: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage when attacking a Pokémon of the same type.

Nidorina.Description: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
Nidorina.Evolution: Nidorina can evolve into Nidoqueen at level 14 and above with the help of a Moon Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Nidorino.AbilityScores: Str 13, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Hustle: When this Pokémon scores a critical hit, it may immediately use the same move to attack again at disadvantage.

Nidorino.Description: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
Nidorino.Evolution: Nidorino can evolve into Nidoking at level 14 and above with the help of a Moon Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Nincada.AbilityScores: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Compound Eyes: This Pokémon gets an additional +1 to attack rolls.

Nincada.Description: Nincada lives underground. It uses its sharp claws to carve the roots of trees and absorb moisture and nutrients. This Pokémon can’t withstand bright sunlight so avoids it.
Nincada.Evolution: Nincada can evolve into Ninjask at level 6 and above. If its trainer has an empty Pokeslot, they also acquire a Shedinja at the same level. The Shedinja has all the base statistics that are in its stat block, plus any health and Ability Score Increases it would obtain from leveling up from its minimum found level. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 15 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

DefensiveAbilities.Drought: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to bright sunlight. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.
DefensiveAbilities.Flash Fire: This Pokémon takes no damage from fire. Instead, immediately after taking a hit from a fire-type move, or in open flames, double the STAB bonus on the next fire-type move.

Ninetales.Description: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.

Ninjask.Description: If Ninjask is not trained properly, it will refuse to obey the Trainer and cry loudly continuously. Because of this quality, this Pokémon is said to be one that puts the Trainer’s abilities to the test.

Vigoroth.Description: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
Vigoroth.Evolution: Vigoroth can evolve into Slaking at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Vileplume.AbilityScores: Str 16, Dex 14, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 14

DefensiveAbilities.Chlorophyll: This Pokémonâ€™s speed is doubled in bright sunlight.
DefensiveAbilities.Effect Spore: When hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of grass damage equal to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.

Vileplume.Description: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.

Volbeat.AbilityScores: Str 16, Dex 14, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Illuminate: This Pokémon knows the Light cantrip and can cast it at will.
DefensiveAbilities.Prankster: Once per short rest, this Pokémon can move to the top of initiative order in a single round, but must use a status-affecting move on its turn.
DefensiveAbilities.Swarm: This Pokémon adds doubles its STAB bonus when it has 10% or less of its maximum health.

Volbeat.Description: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

Voltorb.AbilityScores: Str 12, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 8

DefensiveAbilities.Aftermath: This Pokémon deals damage to an attacker equal to half of the damage received when knocked out by a melee move.
DefensiveAbilities.Soundproof: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.
DefensiveAbilities.Static: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of electric damage equal to this Pokemon's proficiency bonus.

Voltorb.Description: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
Voltorb.Evolution: Voltorb can evolve into Electrode at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Vulpix.AbilityScores: Str 10, Dex 13, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 12

DefensiveAbilities.Drought: When this Pokémon enters an outside battle, the weather immediately changes to bright sunlight. In the case of another Pokémon with a similar weather ability, the tie goes to the Pokémon with the highest DEX score.
DefensiveAbilities.Flash Fire: This Pokémon takes no damage from fire. Instead, immediately after taking a hit from a fire-type move, or in open flames, double the STAB bonus on the next fire-type move.

Vulpix.Description: From its mouth spew flames that seem to resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
Vulpix.Evolution: Vulpix can evolve into Ninetales at level 8 and above with the help of a Fire Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Wailmer.AbilityScores: Str 12, Dex 14, Con 17, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
DefensiveAbilities.Pressure: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly costs an additional 1 PP.
DefensiveAbilities.Water Veil: This Pokémon is immune to burning.

Wailmer.Description: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
Wailmer.Evolution: Wailmer can evolve into Wailord at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 5 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Wailord.AbilityScores: Str 13, Dex 15, Con 20, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
DefensiveAbilities.Pressure: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly costs an additional 1 PP.
DefensiveAbilities.Water Veil: This Pokémon is immune to burning.

Wailord.Description: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

Walrein.AbilityScores: Str 18, Dex 15, Con 20, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Ice Body: While it is snowing or hailing, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency modifier at the end of each of its turns.
DefensiveAbilities.Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
DefensiveAbilities.Thick Fat: This Pokémon takes quarter damage from Fire and Ice type moves.

Walrein.Description: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

Wartortle.AbilityScores: Str 14, Dex 12, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Rain Dish: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.
DefensiveAbilities.Torrent: When this Pokémon falls below 10% of its health, double the STAB damage for its water-type moves.

Wartortle.Description: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s toughness as a battler.
Wartortle.Evolution: Wartortle can evolve into Blastoise at level 14 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Weavile.AbilityScores: Str 17, Dex 20, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Pickpocket: As a bonus action, this Pokémon can make a DEX check contested by the opponentâ€™s WIS to attempt to steal a held item. After the first attempt, all other attempts against the same opponent are rolled at disadvantage.
DefensiveAbilities.Pressure: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly costs an additional 1 PP.

Weavile.Description: They dwell in cold places. This Pokémon’s main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.

Weedle.AbilityScores: Str 9, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Run Away: While this Pokémon is active, the trainer automatically succeeds on their DEX roll to run away from a wild Pokémon encounter.
DefensiveAbilities.Shield Dust: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.

Weedle.Description: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
Weedle.Evolution: Weedle can evolve into Kakuna at level 4 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 5 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Weepinbell.AbilityScores: Str 13, Dex 14, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Chlorophyll: This Pokémonâ€™s speed is doubled in bright sunlight.
DefensiveAbilities.Gluttony: This Pokémon must eat its held berry when it falls below Â½ of its maximum HP.

Weepinbell.Description: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
Weepinbell.Evolution: Weepinbell can evolve into Victreebel at level 14 and above with the help of a Leaf Stone. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Weezing.AbilityScores: Str 16, Dex 14, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 8

DefensiveAbilities.Levitate: This Pokémon is immune to ground moves.

Weezing.Description: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.

Whiscash.AbilityScores: Str 13, Dex 12, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Anticipation: When this Pokémon enters the battle, an opponent must reveal if it has a move that the Pokémon is vulnerable to. The move does not have to be revealed - only that there is such a move.
DefensiveAbilities.Hydration: This Pokémon is unaffected by negative status ailments in water or during rainy conditions.
DefensiveAbilities.Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.

Whiscash.Description: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.

Whismur.AbilityScores: Str 9, Dex 9, Con 12, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 12

DefensiveAbilities.Rattled: When this Pokémon is hit by a damaging Dark, Bug, or Ghost move, it makes its next attack at advantage.
DefensiveAbilities.Soundproof: This Pokémon is immune to sound-based moves.

Whismur.Description: Whismur is very timid. If it starts to cry loudly, it becomes startled by its own crying and cries even harder. When it finally stops crying, the Pokémon goes to sleep, all tired out.
Whismur.Evolution: Whismur can evolve into Loudred at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Wigglytuff.AbilityScores: Str 14, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 14

DefensiveAbilities.Competitive: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage rolls while poisoned, burned, confused, or paralyzed.
DefensiveAbilities.Cute Charm: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.
DefensiveAbilities.Frisk: Upon entering a battle, a single opponentâ€™s held item is revealed, if it has one.

Wigglytuff.Description: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.

Wingull.AbilityScores: Str 9, Dex 15, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Hydration: This Pokémon is unaffected by negative status ailments in water or during rainy conditions.
DefensiveAbilities.Keen Eye: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.
DefensiveAbilities.Rain Dish: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.

Wingull.Description: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever they’re circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokémon.
Wingull.Evolution: Wingull can evolve into Pelipper at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Wobbuffet.AbilityScores: Str 13, Dex 9, Con 18, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Shadow Tag: If this Pokémon is active, an opponent cannot flee or be switched out.
DefensiveAbilities.Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

Wobbuffet.Description: Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won’t attack on its own. However, it won’t endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.

Wooper.AbilityScores: Str 10, Dex 10, Con 12, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 12

DefensiveAbilities.Damp: This Pokémon is unaffected by Self Destruct and Explosion moves.
DefensiveAbilities.Unaware: When this Pokémon attacks an opponent, it ignores any stat boosts the opponent has been affected with since the start of battle. This includes boosts to AC or saving throws the Pokémon has to make.
DefensiveAbilities.Water Absorb: Water type moves do not damage this Pokémon. Instead, half of any water damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

Wooper.Description: Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
Wooper.Evolution: Wooper can evolve into Quagsire at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Wormadam Plant Cloak.AbilityScores: Str 12, Dex 12, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Anticipation: When this Pokémon enters the battle, an opponent must reveal if it has a move that the Pokémon is vulnerable to. The move does not have to be revealed - only that there is such a move.
DefensiveAbilities.Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.

Wormadam Plant Cloak.Description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

Wormadam Sand Cloak.AbilityScores: Str 12, Dex 11, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Anticipation: When this Pokémon enters the battle, an opponent must reveal if it has a move that the Pokémon is vulnerable to. The move does not have to be revealed - only that there is such a move.
DefensiveAbilities.Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.

Wormadam Sand Cloak.Description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

Wormadam Trash Cloak.AbilityScores: Str 12, Dex 13, Con 14, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Anticipation: When this Pokémon enters the battle, an opponent must reveal if it has a move that the Pokémon is vulnerable to. The move does not have to be revealed - only that there is such a move.
DefensiveAbilities.Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.

Wormadam Trash Cloak.Description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

Wurmple.AbilityScores: Str 9, Dex 8, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 12

DefensiveAbilities.Run Away: While this Pokémon is active, the trainer automatically succeeds on their DEX roll to run away from a wild Pokémon encounter.
DefensiveAbilities.Shield Dust: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.

Wurmple.Description: Wurmple is targeted by Swellow as prey. This Pokémon will try to resist by pointing the spikes on its rear at the attacking predator. It will weaken the foe by leaking poison from the spikes.
Wurmple.Evolution: Wurmple can evolve into Silcoon when it reaches level 4 and above during the day, or Cascoon when it reaches level 4 and above at night. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 6 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Wynaut.AbilityScores: Str 10, Dex 8, Con 14, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Shadow Tag: If this Pokémon is active, an opponent cannot flee or be switched out.
DefensiveAbilities.Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

Wynaut.Description: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.
Wynaut.Evolution: Wynaut can evolve into Wobbuffet at level 5 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 8 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Xatu.AbilityScores: Str 13, Dex 17, Con 12, Int 8, Wis 15, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Early Bird: This Pokémon has advantage on rolls to wake from sleep.
DefensiveAbilities.Magic Bounce: Once per long rest, when succumbing to a negative status effect, this Pokémon can instead reflect the effect back on the attacker.
DefensiveAbilities.Synchronize: If this Pokémon becomes burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, its attacker receives the negative status condition as well (if not immune).

Xatu.Description: Xatu is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical Pokémon out of their belief that Xatu is in possession of the power to see into the future.

Yanma.AbilityScores: Str 12, Dex 17, Con 14, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Compound Eyes: This Pokémon gets an additional +1 to attack rolls.
DefensiveAbilities.Frisk: Upon entering a battle, a single opponentâ€™s held item is revealed, if it has one.
DefensiveAbilities.Speed Boost: While this Pokémon is active and in an environment related to its type (DM Discretion), its trainer gets advantage on initiative rolls.

Yanma.Description: Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
Yanma.Evolution: Yanma can evolve into Yanmega at the time 'Ancient Power' is learned. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Yanmega.AbilityScores: Str 15, Dex 18, Con 17, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Frisk: Upon entering a battle, a single opponentâ€™s held item is revealed, if it has one.
DefensiveAbilities.Speed Boost: While this Pokémon is active and in an environment related to its type (DM Discretion), its trainer gets advantage on initiative rolls.

Yanmega.Description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

Zangoose.AbilityScores: Str 15, Dex 17, Con 15, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Immunity: This Pokémon is immune to becoming poisoned.
DefensiveAbilities.Toxic Boost: When this Pokémon is hit by a poison-type attack, its next attack is rolled at advantage.

Zangoose.Description: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

Zapdos.AbilityScores: Str 17, Dex 19, Con 16, Int 6, Wis 14, Cha 16

DefensiveAbilities.Pressure: Any move targeting this Pokémon directly costs an additional 1 PP.
DefensiveAbilities.Static: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a result of 4, the attacker takes an amount of electric damage equal to this Pokemon's proficiency bonus.

Zapdos.Description: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

Zigzagoon.AbilityScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 10, Int 6, Wis 10, Cha 10

DefensiveAbilities.Gluttony: This Pokémon must eat its held berry when it falls below Â½ of its maximum HP.
DefensiveAbilities.Pickup: If an opponent uses a consumable held item in battle, this Pokémon gains a copy of it if it is not currently holding an item.
DefensiveAbilities.Quick Feet: When suffering from a negative status condition, this Pokémonâ€™s speed increases by 15 ft.

Zigzagoon.Description: The hair on Zigzagoon’s back is bristly. It rubs the hard back hair against trees to leave its territorial markings. This Pokémon may play dead to fool foes in battle.
Zigzagoon.Evolution: Zigzagoon can evolve into Linoone at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

Zubat.AbilityScores: Str 10, Dex 14, Con 12, Int 6, Wis 12, Cha 8

DefensiveAbilities.Infiltrator: This Pokémon bypasses Light Screen and Reflect.
DefensiveAbilities.Inner Focus: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

Zubat.Description: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.
Zubat.Evolution: Zubat can evolve into Golbat at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).
